content.raw: What do you mean by point 2?
content.html: What do you mean by point 2?

pull_request.title: Plotting Palette: Topics and Sim tabs

pullrequest.title: Plotting Palette: Topics and Sim tabs

content.raw:
Actually they seem to be aligned in the spec:

https://www.google.com/design/spec/components/tabs.html#tabs-content

Also, we're differing from them on other points:

1. Use all caps

1. Only change transparency between active and unfocused tabs
content.html:
Actually they seem to be aligned in the spec:

https://www.google.com/design/spec/components/tabs.html#tabs-content

Also, we're differing from them on other points:

  1. Use all caps

  2. Only change transparency between active and unfocused tabs

pull_request.title: Plotting Palette: Topics and Sim tabs

pullrequest.title: Plotting Palette: Topics and Sim tabs

content.raw: Yeah, perhaps it's intentional on the part of Material Design...I guess I'll need to give in then. Google knows best. ;)
content.html: Yeah, perhaps it's intentional on the part of Material Design...I guess I'll need to give in then. Google knows best. ;)

content.raw:
As for the SVG, we usually include it as well if available, so we have the source of the PNG.

I wasn't sure what to do about the TTF, we might use them all eventually, so it would be convenient to have them there already. I'll add them to the resources.

As for the SVG, we usually include it as well if available, so we have the source of the PNG.

I wasn't sure what to do about the TTF, we might use them all eventually, so it would be convenient to have them there already. I'll add them to the resources.

pullrequest.title: Plotting Palette: Topics and Sim tabs

content.raw:
I'm not sure who's part this falls into (Ian?), but dropping a variable on the canvas below the XY fields should create the plot and add that variable to the y-axis (dropping the variable into a field also works, as shown here).

Just wanted to make sure that interaction isn't forgotten :)
content.html:
I'm not sure who's part this falls into (Ian?), but dropping a variable on the canvas below the XY fields should create the plot and add that variable to the y-axis (dropping the variable into a field also works, as shown here).

Just wanted to make sure that interaction isn't forgotten :)
